Description: Fragment of undyed dark brown (almost black), woollen plain weave textile ; with overspun, single ply, ‘s’-spun yarns for the warp and weft; thread count of 9x10 threads per centimetre; and ragged edges. A blue thread lying on the back of the fragment is single ply, ‘s’-spun and approximately 8mm long.
Acquisition name: Donated by: Dr William Yewdale Adams
Donated by: W S Webb Museum of Anthropology (University of Kentucky)
